Panel.headerText: How is the consumption of electricity billed?

html:li.html:h5: Customer is billed according to the category and the tariff schedule in force.
The components are applicable as per the customer category.

Panel.headerText: What is one unit of power?

html:li.html:h5: All electrical equipment draw power when switched ON.
The amount of energy consumed is measured in kilowatt hours (kWh) which is one "unit" of electricity.
One kWh or unit of electrical energy is consumed when "Wattage of the equipment" multiplied by "the usage in hours" equals 1000 Watt-hour, i.e. 1 kWh or one unit.
One unit is thus, the amount of energy consumed in lighting a 100 watt bulb for 10 hours or using a 2 kW (2000 watt) geyser for Â½ hour.

html:div.html:h5: The electricity meter records consumption in units and the same is billed as energy charges.

Panel.headerText: What is Maximum Demand (MD)?

html:li.html:h5: Maximum Demand or MD is the maximum amount of power the customer has consumed in 30-minutes slot timed from 00 hrs by internal clock in the meter during the month.
It is recorded in kVA by a trivector meter.

Panel.headerText: What is Power Factor?

html:li.html:h5: Many large customers draw more electrical power than can be actually converted into useful energy.
This extra power, which does no useful work, is called the reactive energy and is measured in reactive units (rkVAh).
This reactive energy is related to the power factor of the load.
The lower the power factor, the more is the reactive energy drawn resulting in overloading of supply cables.
Certain types of equipment like motors, air-conditioning units etc. inherently have low power factor.
The power factor can be improved by installing capacitors.
Power factor surcharge is levied, if the power factor is less than the particular value set by MERC.
Similarly incentive is also given for maintaining higher power factor..

Panel.headerText: What is Fuel Adjustment Charges or FAC?

html:li.html:h5: The prevailing tariff for energy is based on an average cost of fuel consumed for thermal generation in TTata Power.
The actual cost of fuel may vary from this cost.
To account for this difference in price, a "Fuel Adjustment Charge" (FAC) is levied

Panel.headerText: What is Electricity Duty?

html:li.html:h5: The electricity duty is levied by the State Government in accordance with the Bombay Electricity Duty Act, 1958, as amended from time to time.
This amount is collected on behalf of the State Government.

Panel.headerText: What is Tax on Sale of Electricity?

html:div.html:h5: Tax on sale of electricity is levied on all units sold in accordance with Maharashtra State Tax on Sale of Electricity Act, 1963.

Panel.headerText: What is Delayed Payment Charges or DPC?

html:li.html:h5: In case electricity bills are not paid within the due date mention on the bill, delayed payment charges of 2 percent on the total electricity bill (including Taxes & Duties) shall be levied on the bill amount.

For the purpose of computation of time limit for payment of bills, "The day of presentation of bill" or "the date the bill" or "the date of issue of the bill", etc., as the case may be, will not be excluded.

Panel.headerText: What is Prompt Payment Discount?

html:div.html:h5: A prompt payment discount of 1 percent on the monthly bill (Excluding taxes & Duties) shall be available to the consumers if the bills are paid within a period of 7 working days from the date of issue of the bill.

Panel.headerText: What is Minimum Monthly Charges?

html:div.html:h5: This is the minimum amount per month, which the customer has to pay even if no electricity is consumed during the month.

Panel.headerText: What is Multiplication Factor (MF) and how is it calculated? How is it different from mine to others?

html:li.html:h5: MF means Multiplying Factor which is used to calculate your bill.
Energy meters are generally designed to withstand continuously 440 Volts and a maximum of 60 A current.

If customer's load is more than 60 A or supply voltage is higher than 440 Volts, Current and voltage transformers are used in metering circuit to restrict the current and voltage to the rated capacity of meter.
These transformers reduce the voltage & current applied to meter in certain proportion which is called transformation ratio.
The consumption recorded by the meter is therefore less than the actual consumption of the customer in the same proportion.
To arrive at actual consumption of customer, consumption registered by meter is multiplied by proportionality factor which is called Multiplying factor or MF.
Thus MF = CT ratio X VT ratio
The ratio for CT & VT for a particular customer is designed in accordance with customer's load requirement and load pattern.

Panel.headerText: Who should one contact for common billing and metering queries?

html:div.html:h5: Even though every effort is made to eliminate billing errors, should the customer face any problem may contact our "Call Centre" at the following telephone numbers: 1800 209 5161 (Toll Free).

Panel.headerText: What does a new customer do if the first electricity bill is not received?

html:li.html:h5: The meters of all customers are read once every month.
The meter readings are recorded area-wise and on particular dates.
If the intimation regarding a new customer is received after the metering cycle in that area is completed, the new customer's metering would appear only in the next cycle of reading.
If the bill is not received even after 2 months of initial power connection, you should contact "Call Center" immediately.

Panel.headerText: What does one do if a bill has not been received or is lost?

html:div.html:h5: The customer should contact the "Call Centrer" or Consumer Relations Dept. and collect a duplicate bill. The duplicate bill will be sent to him by courier or fax.

Panel.headerText: Who should the customer contact if the tariff applied is not correct?

html:div.html:h5: The customer should contact the "Call Centre" and the matter will be attended to.

Panel.headerText: What does one do if the meter reading on the bill appears incorrect?

html:div.html:h5: You may register your complaint at Call Centre. On receipt of the complaint, the meter readings will be checked and necessary action will be taken and informed to the customer.

Panel.headerText: What should be done if the current bill shows arrears even though the previous bill has been paid within the stipulated period?

html:li.html:h5: While printing the electricity bill, payment details up to a certain date only are considered.
Payments made after this date will, therefore, not be reflected in the new bill.
If the copy of the receipt of the earlier payment made is submitted to the Consumer Relations Department, necessary corrections would be made on the bill and the balance amount will be accepted.

Panel.headerText: Why does a bill indicate nil or low units even though the consumption has been regular?

html:div.html:h5: This can be due to the meter or the metering installation becoming defective. To avoid getting a bigger amended bill later on, bring this to the company's notice immediately by contacting the "Call Center". Lower bill may also be due to wrong reading taken for billing, due to human error, although every care is taken to avoid such errors.

Panel.headerText: Why does a bill appear to be in excess of the usual?

html:li.html:h5: Normally high bills are due to higher consumption, because of some new electrical equipment added or some festivals or special occasions, like a marriage in the family or, change of weather etc.
If not, compare your unit consumption with earlier bills preferably for similar period.
Use the ready reckoner available on the website to estimate your consumption.
Even if the unit consumption is normal, the bill amount can increase due to tariff revision, increase in FAC or Government duty.
An excess bill could also be due to incorrect reading taken for billing.
This can be verified by checking the reading on your meter.
If not satisfied, contact the "Call Center" and the matter will be investigated further.

Panel.headerText: Does the Tata Power meter reader go every month to read the meter, or is the bill prepared on estimated consumption every alternate month?

html:div.html:h5: The meters of all customers are read once in a month. The meter readings are recorded area-wise and on particular dates. Hence the bills that are send to the customers are based on actual consumption of the customer in the particular month.

Panel.headerText: Why does the bill show that the units have been consumed even though the premises were unoccupied and locked?

html:div.html:h5: Upon receiving the complaint through the "Call Centre", the meter reading will be checked and the meter tested. If meter tests healthy, it would mean that the meter had recorded correctly. The responsibility of the customer's main switch rests on the customer. If someone has used electricity supply tapping from this main switch, the company is not responsible and the owner has to pay for the units recorded. It is, therefore, in owner's interest to keep the meter under lock and key with access to the responsible authorised personnel only.

Panel.headerText: How is billing adjustment made for the defective metering period?

html:div.html:h5: The meter will be tested on a dispute raised by the customer on payment of testing fees. If it is found to be beyond the tolerance limits, the testing fees will be refunded. If the meter or metering installation develops a fault or ceases to register the actual consumption or maximum demand, the consumption during the defective period will be assessed based on the MERC guidelines and necessary correction will be given as applicable. If you apprehend that the meter is not functioning correctly, report immediately so that checking and rectification can be carried out. If the meter or metering installation is found tampered with, the Company would assess the consumption and bill for the same. Penalty will also be changed as per Electricity Act. If a person tampers with company's installation the person is liable for imprisonment and or fine as per the Electricity Act.

Panel.headerText: Can a customer replace the main supply fuse installed by the company?

html:div.html:h5: The meter boards, main cut-outs, fuse, etc., should on no account be interfered with by any one other than the Company's authorised representative. The seals, which are fixed on the meters and the Company's apparatus, must never be tampered with. The Company seals are placed to protect their apparatus. Should this be ignored or disobeyed or disregarded, the customer shall render himself liable to a penalty under the new Electricity Act, 2003. If a person tampers with the Company's installation the person is liable for imprisonment and/or fine as per the Electricity Act.

Panel.headerText: Provision under Electricity Act 2003.

html:div.html:h5: he relevant part from the new Electricity Act 2003 is quoted as below : PART - XIV : OFFENCES AND PENALTIES Theft of electricity - 135.

html:li.html:h5: Whoever, dishonestly.
taps, makes or causes to be made any connection with overhead, underground or under water lines or cables, or service wires, or service facilities of a licensee; or

tampers a meter, installs or uses a tampered meter, current transformer, loop connection or any other device or method which interferes with accurate or proper registration, calibration or metering of electric current or otherwise results in a manner whereby electricity is stolen or wasted; or

damages or destroys an electric meter, apparatus, equipment , or wire or causes or allows any of them to be so damaged or destroyed as to interfere with the proper or accurate metering of electricity, so as to abstract or consume or use electricity, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years or with fine or with both: Provided that in a case where the load abstracted, consumed, or used or attempted abstraction or attempted consumption or attempted use,

exceeds 10 kilowatt, the fine imposed on first conviction shall not be less than three times the financial gain on account of such theft of electricity and in the event of second or subsequent conviction, the sentence shall be imprisonment for a term not less than six months but which may extend to five years and with fine not less than six times the financial gain on account of such theft of electricity: Provided further that if it is proved that any artificial means or means not authorised by the Board or licensee exist for the abstraction, consumption or use of electricity by the customer, it shall be presumed, until the contrary is proved that any abstraction, consumption or use of electricity has been dishonestly caused by such customer.
